org.sensorhub.api.sensor

Interface ISensorDataInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IEventProducer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSensorOutput

    public interface ISensorDataInterface
extends IEventProducer

    Interface to be implemented by all sensor drivers connected to the system.

    Data provided by this interface can be actual measurements but also status information. Each sensor output is mapped to a separate instance of this interface, allowing them to have completely independent sampling rates.

    Implementations must at least be capable of retaining the latest record received from sensor and make it available with getLatestRecord()

    If push is supported, implementation MUST produce events of type SensorDataEvent when new data is received or polled from sensor.

    Copyright (c) 2014

    Since:
    Nov 5, 2010
    Author:
    Alexandre Robin

    • Method Detail

      • getParentSensor

        ISensorModule<?> getParentSensor()
        Allows by-reference access to parent sensor module
        Returns:
        parent sensor

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the interface name.

        It should be the name reported in the map by getXXXOutputs methods of ISensorModule

        Returns:
        name of this output interface
        See Also:
        ISensorModule.getAllOutputs()

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Checks if this interface is enabled
        Returns:
        true if interface is enabled, false otherwise

      • isStorageSupported

        boolean isStorageSupported()
        Checks data storage capability

        Note that storage can be provided by the sensor itself or by the driver.

        Returns:
        true if record storage is supported internally, false otherwise

      • isPushSupported

        boolean isPushSupported()
        Checks push capability

        Note that 'push' can generally be simulated by the driver even if the sensor doesn't support it natively.

        Returns:
        true if notifications are sent when new data is available, false otherwise

      • getAverageSamplingPeriod

        double getAverageSamplingPeriod()
        Gets the average rate at which this interface produces data
        Returns:
        sampling period in seconds

      • getRecordDescription

        net.opengis.swe.v20.DataComponent getRecordDescription()
        Retrieves the record definition for this output

        Note that this is usually sent by reference and MUST not be modified by the caller. If you really need to modify it, first get an independent copy using DataComponent.copy()

        Returns:
        a DataComponent object defining the structure of the output

      • getRecommendedEncoding

        net.opengis.swe.v20.DataEncoding getRecommendedEncoding()
        Provides the recommended encoding for this sensor data

        Note that this is usually sent by reference and MUST not be modified by the caller. If you really need to modify it, first get an independent copy using net.opengis.swe.v20.DataEncoding#copy()

        Returns:
        recommended encoding description

      • getLatestRecord

        net.opengis.swe.v20.DataBlock getLatestRecord()
                                              throws SensorException
        Gets the latest record received on this data channel. Even implementations with no storage support must always retain the last record and implement this method.

        When storage is supported, this method does not cause data to be removed from memory.

        Note that this does not trigger a new measurement but simply retrieves the result of the last measurement made.

        Returns:
        the last measurement record or null if no data is available
        Throws:
        SensorException - if there is a problem retrieving latest measurement from sensor

      • getLatestRecordTime

        double getLatestRecordTime()
        Used to check when the last measurement was made.

        Note: this method is useful to know if a measurement has really been made since the last call to getLatestRecord().

        Returns:
        time of last measurement as julian time (1970) or NaN if no measurement was made yet

      • getStorageCapacity

        int getStorageCapacity()
                       throws SensorException
        Gets the internal storage capacity.
        This method must be implemented if isStorageSupported() returns true.
        Returns:
        maximum number of records that can be stored
        Throws:
        SensorException - if storage is not supported or a problem occured while checking sensor on-board storage capacity

      • getNumberOfAvailableRecords

        int getNumberOfAvailableRecords()
                                throws SensorException
        Retrieves number of record currectly available from driver or on-board sensor memory.
        This method must be implemented if isStorageSupported() returns true.
        Returns:
        the number of available records
        Throws:
        SensorException - if storage is not supported or a problem occured while reading from on-board sensor storage

      • getLatestRecords

        List<net.opengis.swe.v20.DataBlock> getLatestRecords(int maxRecords,
                                                   boolean clear)
                                                     throws SensorException
        Retrieves the N last records stored.
        This method must be implemented if isStorageSupported() returns true.
        Parameters:
        maxRecords - Maximum number of records to retrieve
        clear - if true, also clears records from driver or sensor memory
        Returns:
        a list of records sorted by acquisition time (empty if no records are available)
        Throws:
        SensorException - if storage is not supported or a problem occured while reading from on-board sensor storage

      • getAllRecords

        List<net.opengis.swe.v20.DataBlock> getAllRecords(boolean clear)
                                                  throws SensorException
        Retrieves all records stored by the driver or sensor.
        This method must be implemented if isStorageSupported() returns true.
        Parameters:
        clear - if true, also clears records from driver or sensor memory
        Returns:
        the list of all records in storage sorted by acquisition time (empty if no records are available)
        Throws:
        SensorException - if storage is not supported or a problem occured while reading from on-board sensor storage

      • clearAllRecords

        int clearAllRecords()
                    throws SensorException
        Clears all records currently stored in driver or sensor memory.
        This method must be implemented if isStorageSupported() returns true.
        Returns:
        number of records removed
        Throws:
        SensorException - if storage is not supported or a problem occured while clearing on-board sensor storage
